rows.title: The Joy of the Priesthood
rows.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
rows.subtitle: Let us embrace and understand the wonder and privilege of the priesthood. Let us accept and love the responsibilities we are asked to fulfill.

rows.title: Are You Sleeping through the Restoration?
rows.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
rows.subtitle: There is too much at stake for us as individuals, as families, and as Christ's Church to give only a halfhearted effort to this sacred work.

rows.title: When the Lord Commands
rows.author: Bruce A. Carlson
rows.subtitle: Faithful obedience, regardless of the apparent size of the task, will bring the Lord's guidance, assistance, and peace.

rows.title: We Are Doing a Great Work and Cannot Come Down
rows.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
rows.subtitle: We cannot and we must not allow ourselves to get distracted from our sacred duty. We cannot and we must not lose focus on the things that matter most.

rows.title: A Higher Joy
rows.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
rows.subtitle: May we all seek and find the higher joy that comes from devoting our lives to our Heavenly Father and His Beloved Son.

rows.title: Earthly Debts, Heavenly Debts
rows.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin
rows.subtitle: We have earthly debts and heavenly debts. Let us be wise in dealing with each of them.

rows.title: To the Women of the Church
rows.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
rows.subtitle: Thank you for being the kind of people you are and doing the things you do. May the blessings of heaven rest upon you.

rows.title: Meeting the Challenges of Today's World
rows.author: Robert D. Hales
rows.subtitle: The choices you make—mission, education, marriage, career, and service in the Church—will shape your eternal destiny.

rows.title: The Best Investment
rows.author: Sheldon F. Child
rows.subtitle: If you always pay an honest tithing, the Lord will bless you. It will be the best investment you will ever make.

rows.title: Lay Up in Store
rows.author: By Bishop Keith B. McMullin
rows.subtitle: We call upon priesthood bearers to store sufficient so that you and your family can weather the vicissitudes of life.

rows.title: To Heal the Shattering Consequences of Abuse
rows.author: Richard G. Scott
rows.subtitle: The power of healing is inherent in the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

rows.title: Personal Worthiness to Exercise the Priesthood
rows.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
rows.subtitle: Our behavior in public must be above reproach. Our behavior in private is even more important. It must clear the standard set by the Lord.

rows.title: The Women in Our Lives
rows.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
rows.subtitle: How thankful I am, how thankful we all must be, for the women in our lives.

rows.title: Protect the Children
rows.author: Dallin H. Oaks
rows.subtitle: None should resist the plea that we unite to increase our concern for the welfare and future of our children—the rising generation.

rows.title: A Tragic Evil among Us
rows.author: Gordon B. Hinckley
rows.subtitle: [Pornography] is like a raging storm, destroying individuals and families, utterly ruining what was once wholesome and beautiful.

rows.title: The Keys and Authority of the Priesthood
rows.author: Dallin H. Oaks
rows.subtitle: Priesthood keys direct women as well as men, and priesthood ordinances and priesthood authority pertain to women as well as men.

rows.title: The Power of the Priesthood
rows.author: Boyd K. Packer
rows.subtitle: The priesthood does not have the strength that it should have and will not have until the power of the priesthood is firmly fixed in the families.

rows.title: The Powers of Heaven
rows.author: David A. Bednar
rows.subtitle: Priesthood holders young and old need both authority and power—the necessary permission and the spiritual capacity to represent God in the work of salvation.

rows.title: Honoring the Priesthood
rows.author: By Bishop H. David Burton
rows.subtitle: Priesthood isn't something we take off during the week and put on for Sunday. It is a 24-7 privilege and blessing—that is, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

rows.title: LDS Women Are Incredible!
rows.author: Quentin L. Cook
rows.subtitle: Much of what we accomplish in the Church is due to the selfless service of women.

results.query: how to be more charitable to others

rows.title: Charity Never Faileth
rows.author: By Silvia H. Allred
rows.subtitle: Plead for a desire to be filled with the gift of charity, the pure love of Christ.

rows.title: I Will Bring the Light of the Gospel into My Home
rows.author: By Jean B. Bingham
rows.subtitle: We can bring the light of the gospel into our homes, schools, and workplaces if we look for and share positive things about others.

rows.title: One More Day
rows.author: Taylor G. Godoy
rows.subtitle: We all have a "today" to live, and the key to making our day successful is to be willing to sacrifice.

rows.title: Charity Never Faileth
rows.author: Thomas S. Monson
rows.subtitle: Rather than being judgmental and critical of each other, may we have the pure love of Christ for our fellow travelers in this journey through life.

rows.title: Tested and Tempted—but Helped
rows.author: Hugo Montoya
rows.subtitle: We can help each other as children of our Heavenly Father in our trials and temptations.

rows.title: The Healing Power of Forgiveness
rows.author: James E. Faust
rows.subtitle: If we can find forgiveness in our hearts for those who have caused us hurt and injury, we will rise to a higher level of self-esteem and well-being.

rows.title: The Healing Ointment of Forgiveness
rows.author: Kevin R. Duncan
rows.subtitle: Forgiveness is a glorious, healing principle. We do not need to be a victim twice. We can forgive.

rows.title: Forgiveness Will Change Bitterness to Love
rows.author: David E. Sorensen
rows.subtitle: Forgiveness means that problems of the past no longer dictate our destinies, and we can focus on the future with God's love in our hearts.

rows.title: The Merciful Obtain Mercy
rows.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
rows.subtitle: When our hearts are filled with the love of God, we become "kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving."

rows.title: Even as Christ Forgives You, So Also Do Ye
rows.author: Larry J. Echo Hawk
rows.subtitle: We can all receive unspeakable peace and partnering with our Savior as we learn to freely forgive those who have trespassed against us.
